channel.title: OSCAL Documentation on OSCAL
channel.description: Recent content in OSCAL Documentation on OSCAL

item.title: OSCAL Content Examples
item.description: The OSCAL content GitHub repository provides many examples of OSCAL-formatted data including both actual data and mockups for demonstration.

item.title: Relations to Other Documentary Encoding Standards
item.description: Professionals working in the security domain are already familiar with numerous standards, specifications, guidelines and regulatory frameworks that define and describe practice in the systems security arena: NIST SP800-53, ISO 27002, FedRAMP, FISMA/FIPS, HIPAA and others. OSCAL's models are designed to capture the full range of these. However, OSCAL is not the only text encoding technology available, and it is not always the most suitable, depending on the task at hand.
